DataAnalyzer.Plot package¶

Submodules¶

DataAnalyzer.Plot.cl_plot module¶

class DataAnalyzer.Plot.cl_plot.Plot(data, key)[source]¶

Plot is responsible for building the Plot from the Data inside of a FileData object. The created axes objects can be accessed via Plot.figure[..].subplot[…]

Therefore it receives the arguments Data and key upon instantiation. Data can either be the name of a .mat file or an already created instance of FileData. key is the name of the Plot that should be plotted.

Parameters:
  • data (str or object) – name of .mat file or instance of FileData
  • key (str) – name of the Plot type
class Subplot(subplot: list)[source]¶

dataclass in which the subplots are stored as a list

DataAnalyzer.Plot.cl_regression module¶

This module can be used to add trendlines to the plots.

Todo

Add more regression types (trigo, log, …).

class DataAnalyzer.Plot.cl_regression.Exponential(ax)[source]¶

Create an exponential regression

Todo

currently only two parameters are calculated of the form y = a(e^bx). Add a third parameter c: y = a(e^bx) + c

Read the Data from the axes and calculate the sums of x- and y-Data

Parameters:ax (object) – axis object
fit()[source]¶

Calculate the parameters with the method of smallest error squares

class DataAnalyzer.Plot.cl_regression.Linear(ax)[source]¶

Create a linear regression

Read the Data from the axes and calculate the sums of x- and y-Data

Parameters:ax (object) – axis object
fit()[source]¶

Calculate the parameters with the method of smallest error squares

class DataAnalyzer.Plot.cl_regression.Regression(ax)[source]¶

The specific regression types inherit from this class.

Read the Data from the axes and calculate the sums of x- and y-Data

Parameters:ax (object) – axis object
class DataAnalyzer.Plot.cl_regression.Root(ax)[source]¶

Create a square root regression

Read the Data from the axes and calculate the sums of x- and y-Data

Parameters:ax (object) – axis object
fit()[source]¶

Calculate the parameters with the method of smallest error squares

DataAnalyzer.Plot.cl_zoom module¶

This module is used to automatically adjust the y-limits upon zoom.

Todo

Currently the x- and y-Data is read from the axes objects every time the limits are changed. It would be sufficient to read them only once upon creation.

class DataAnalyzer.Plot.cl_zoom.Zoom(ax)[source]¶

Zoom implements a functionality for automatically altering the y-limits of the linked subplots.

create callback for ax on event xlim_changed
